knimeNode.name: Region View
knimeNode.shortDescription: Provides visualization of data in shapefile regions.

fullDescription.intro: This node can visualize data in a geographical map. The geographical map is read from the shape table in first port. The input table in the second port must contain the IDs of the shapefile regions. Any other data in the input table can be used for highlighting (as explained below).

tab.name: Input
tab.option: Shape table column containing the shapes.
Shapefile column containing the region IDs.
Node table column containing the region IDs.
When checked a svg graphic instead of a png is put in the ouput port.

tab.name: Options Bar
tab.option: Current editing mode. If "Transforming" is selected the user can move the graph by using the mouse. In "Picking" mode the user can select and unselect nodes.
If checked, a legend with all highlight conditions, which have "Show in Legend" activated, is display in the lower left corner of the canvas.
Font Size and type (plain or bold) can be specified here. This font is used for node labels and in the legend.
Small Label, that is displayed in the upper right corner of the graph image.
Alpha value used to draw the geographical borders.

tab.name: Context Menu
tab.option: Resets translation and scale to default.
The image as can be saved as a PNG- or SVG-file.
Shows the properties of all selected nodes.
Clears node selection.
Opens a dialog to help the user highlight all selected nodes.
Opens a dialog to add, remove and edit Highlight Conditions for nodes.
Removes all Highlight Conditions for nodes.
All nodes that have non zero values for the specified Highlight Condition will be selected.
Automatically creates Node Highlight Conditions for all categories of parameter.
Opens a dialog to select nodes based on a logical condition.

tab.name: Highlight Condition List Dialog
tab.option: This dialog lets you manage the Highlight Conditions, either for nodes or edges. To edit a Condition double click on it.
Adds a new Highlight Condition to the list.
Removes the selected Highlight Condition from the list.
If selected, the color of each condition overwrites all colors of conditions below it. Otherwise the colors are mixed.
Moves the selected condition up.
Moves the selected condition down.

tab.name: Highlight Condition Dialog
tab.option: Type of the condition: "Logical Condition", "Value Condition" or "Logical Value Condition". Types are explained in the sections below.
Name of the condition. The name is used in the "Highlight Condition List Dialog" and in the legend.
If selected the condition will be shown in the legend.

Color of the highlighted elements. For a logical conditions all true elements are painted. For a value condition all elements with values > 0 are painted (the higher the value the higher alpha value used for painting).
Property, that should be used as a label for all true elements and elements with values > 0.

tab.name: Logical Condition
tab.option: A logical condition is an And/Or conjunction of logical expressions like "City == Berlin" or "Inhabitants > 10". It can only be true or false.
When a logical condition consists of multiple expressions, And/Or conjunctions between these expressions must be specified. "And"-conjunctions will be evaluated before "Or"-conjunctions.
Property of the logical expression. Is compared to "Value".
Type of the logical expression.
Value of the logical expression. Is compared to "Property".

tab.name: Value Condition
tab.option: A value condition uses numerical properties, for example "Log value of Inhabitants".
Property of the value condition.
Type of the value condition. If "Log Value" is used, the logarithmic function with base 10 is applied to all property values, before visualizing. For "Value" no function is applied.

tab.name: Logical Value Condition
tab.option: A logical value condition is a value condition that is only applied to elements, for which the logical condition is true.
